text: The Bad Seed is a 1956 American horror movie. It has elements of film noir. This movie is based on the 1954 play of the same name. ==Plot== On her piano, eight year old Rhoda Penmark (played by Patty McCormack) plays the French song "Au clair de la lune" while her father says his good-byes and goes on military duty. Rhoda is under the care of her mother Christine (Nancy Kelly). Rhoda begins as a well-behaved child. As the movie goes on, she shows her evil side. She commits murder, steals and sets fires. A lightning bolt during a rainstorm kills Rhoda instantly. ==Cast== * Nancy Kelly as Christine Penmark * Patty McCormack as Rhoda Penmark * Henry Jones as Leroy Jessup * Eileen Heckart as Hortense Daigle * Evelyn Varden as Monica Breedlove * William Hopper as Col. Kenneth Penmark * Paul Fix as Richard Bravo * Jesse White as Emory Wages * Gage Clarke as Reginald 'Reggie' Tasker * Joan Croydon as Claudia Fern (as Joan Croyden) * Frank Cady as Henry Daigle ==Reception== This was one of Warner Bros. biggest movies of the year. It took in $4.1 million in the American box office. It was also popular in the British box office. The movie was nominated for four Academy Awards, including Best Actress, Best Actress in a Supporting Role and Best Cinematography. ==Remakes== The Bad Seed was remade for television in 1985 and 2018. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1950s horror movies Category:1950s psychological movies Category:1956 drama movies Category:1950s American drama movies Category:American horror movies Category:Movies about murderers Category:Movies about child death Category:Movies directed by Mervyn LeRoy
